verses.kjv: Moreover Ahithophel said unto Absalom, Let me now choose out twelve thousand men, and I will arise and pursue after David this night:
verses.web: Moreover Ahithophel said to Absalom, “Let me now choose twelve thousand men, and I will arise and pursue after David tonight.
verses.ct: Ahithophel said to Absalom, "Let me handpick 12,000 men. I'll set out tonight and chase down David.

verses.kjv: And I will come upon him while he is weary and weak handed, and will make him afraid: and all the people that are with him shall flee; and I will smite the king only:
verses.web: I will come on him while he is weary and exhausted, and will make him afraid. All the people who are with him will flee. I will strike the king only,
verses.ct: I'll catch him while he's exhausted and worn out, and I'll throw him into a panic. Everyone with him will scatter, and I'll kill only the king.

verses.kjv: And I will bring back all the people unto thee: the man whom thou seekest is as if all returned: so all the people shall be in peace.
verses.web: and I will bring back all the people to you. The man whom you seek is as if all returned. All the people shall be in peace.”
verses.ct: Then I'll bring all his followers back to you. Once the one man you're after is dead, everyone else will come over peacefully."

verses.kjv: And the saying pleased Absalom well, and all the elders of Israel.
verses.web: The saying pleased Absalom well, and all the elders of Israel.
verses.ct: This plan sounded good to Absalom and to all the elders of Israel.

verses.kjv: Then said Absalom, Call now Hushai the Archite also, and let us hear likewise what he saith.
verses.web: Then Absalom said, “Now call Hushai the Archite also, and let’s hear likewise what he says.”
verses.ct: But then Absalom said, "Bring in Hushai the Archite too. Let's hear what he thinks."

verses.kjv: And when Hushai was come to Absalom, Absalom spake unto him, saying, Ahithophel hath spoken after this manner: shall we do after his saying? if not; speak thou.
verses.web: When Hushai had come to Absalom, Absalom spoke to him, saying, “Ahithophel has spoken like this. Shall we do what he says? If not, speak up.”
verses.ct: When Hushai arrived, Absalom told him, "Here's what Ahithophel is recommending. Should we follow his plan? If not, tell us what you think."

verses.kjv: And Hushai said unto Absalom, The counsel that Ahithophel hath given is not good at this time.
verses.web: Hushai said to Absalom, “The counsel that Ahithophel has given this time is not good.”
verses.ct: Hushai told Absalom, "This time, Ahithophel's advice is not good."

verses.kjv: For, said Hushai, thou knowest thy father and his men, that they be mighty men, and they be chafed in their minds, as a bear robbed of her whelps in the field: and thy father is a man of war, and will not lodge with the people.
verses.web: Hushai said moreover, “You know your father and his men, that they are mighty men, and they are fierce in their minds, like a bear robbed of her cubs in the field. Your father is a man of war, and will not lodge with the people.
verses.ct: He continued, "You know your father and his men — they're fierce warriors. Right now they're as dangerous as a mother bear whose cubs have been stolen. Your father is an experienced soldier. He won't be sleeping out in the open with the rest of his people."

verses.kjv: Behold, he is hid now in some pit, or in some other place: and it will come to pass, when some of them be overthrown at the first, that whosoever heareth it will say, There is a slaughter among the people that follow Absalom.
verses.web: Behold, he is now hidden in some pit, or in some other place. It will happen, when some of them have fallen at the first, that whoever hears it will say, ‘There is a slaughter among the people who follow Absalom!’
verses.ct: "Right now he's probably hiding in a cave or some other spot. If even a few of your men fall in the first clash, word will spread fast: 'Absalom's army has been slaughtered!'

verses.kjv: And he also that is valiant, whose heart is as the heart of a lion, shall utterly melt: for all Israel knoweth that thy father is a mighty man, and they which be with him are valiant men.
verses.web: Even he who is valiant, whose heart is as the heart of a lion, will utterly melt; for all Israel knows that your father is a mighty man, and those who are with him are valiant men.
verses.ct: Then even the bravest soldier — someone with the heart of a lion — will lose all courage. Because everyone in Israel knows your father is a mighty warrior, and the men with him are fearless."

verses.kjv: Therefore I counsel that all Israel be generally gathered unto thee, from Dan even to Beersheba, as the sand that is by the sea for multitude; and that thou go to battle in thine own person.
verses.web: But I counsel that all Israel be gathered together to you, from Dan even to Beersheba, as the sand that is by the sea for multitude; and that you go to battle in your own person.
verses.ct: "So here's my advice: gather all of Israel to your side, from Dan to Beersheba — an army as countless as sand on the seashore — and lead them into battle yourself.

verses.kjv: So shall we come upon him in some place where he shall be found, and we will light upon him as the dew falleth on the ground: and of him and of all the men that are with him there shall not be left so much as one.
verses.web: So we will come on him in some place where he will be found, and we will light on him as the dew falls on the ground, then we will not leave so much as one of him and of all the men who are with him.
verses.ct: Then we'll find him wherever he's hiding and fall on him the way dew settles on the ground. Not one of them will survive — not him, not a single man with him.

verses.kjv: Moreover, if he be gotten into a city, then shall all Israel bring ropes to that city, and we will draw it into the river, until there be not one small stone found there.
verses.web: Moreover, if he has gone into a city, then all Israel will bring ropes to that city, and we will draw it into the river, until there isn’t one small stone found there.”
verses.ct: And if he retreats into a city, all of Israel will bring ropes to that city, and we'll drag it stone by stone into the river until not even a pebble is left."

verses.kjv: And Absalom and all the men of Israel said, The counsel of Hushai the Archite is better than the counsel of Ahithophel. For the LORD had appointed to defeat the good counsel of Ahithophel, to the intent that the LORD might bring evil upon Absalom.
verses.web: Absalom and all the men of Israel said, “The counsel of Hushai the Archite is better than the counsel of Ahithophel.” For LORD had ordained to defeat the good counsel of Ahithophel, to the intent that LORD might bring evil on Absalom.
verses.ct: Absalom and all the men of Israel said, "Hushai the Archite's plan is better than Ahithophel's." This happened because the LORD had determined to undermine Ahithophel's good advice so that the LORD could bring disaster on Absalom.

verses.kjv: Then said Hushai unto Zadok and to Abiathar the priests, Thus and thus did Ahithophel counsel Absalom and the elders of Israel; and thus and thus have I counselled.
verses.web: Then Hushai said to Zadok and to Abiathar the priests, “Ahithophel counseled Absalom and the elders of Israel that way; and I have counseled this way.
verses.ct: Hushai quickly went to the priests Zadok and Abiathar and told them, "Here's what Ahithophel advised Absalom and the elders, and here's what I advised instead.

verses.kjv: Now therefore send quickly, and tell David, saying, Lodge not this night in the plains of the wilderness, but speedily pass over; lest the king be swallowed up, and all the people that are with him.
verses.web: Now therefore send quickly, and tell David, saying, ‘Don’t lodge tonight at the fords of the wilderness, but by all means pass over; lest the king be swallowed up, and all the people who are with him.’ ”
verses.ct: Send word to David right away. Tell him, 'Don't spend tonight at the river crossings in the wilderness. Cross over immediately, or the king and everyone with him will be destroyed.'"

verses.kjv: Now Jonathan and Ahimaaz stayed by Enrogel; for they might not be seen to come into the city: and a wench went and told them; and they went and told king David.
verses.web: Now Jonathan and Ahimaaz were staying by En Rogel; and a female servant used to go and tell them; and they went and told king David. For they might not be seen to come into the city.
verses.ct: Jonathan and Ahimaaz were waiting at En Rogel, since they couldn't risk being seen entering the city. A servant girl would go out and pass messages to them, and they would carry the news to King David.

verses.kjv: Nevertheless a lad saw them, and told Absalom: but they went both of them away quickly, and came to a man’s house in Bahurim, which had a well in his court; whither they went down.
verses.web: But a boy saw them, and told Absalom. Then they both went away quickly, and came to the house of a man in Bahurim, who had a well in his court; and they went down there.
verses.ct: But a young man spotted them and reported it to Absalom. So the two of them hurried away and came to the house of a man in Bahurim who had a well in his courtyard. They climbed down into it.

verses.kjv: And the woman took and spread a covering over the well’s mouth, and spread ground corn thereon; and the thing was not known.
verses.web: The woman took and spread the covering over the well’s mouth, and spread out crushed grain on it; and nothing was known.
verses.ct: The man's wife spread a covering over the mouth of the well and scattered grain on top of it, so no one could tell anything was there.

verses.kjv: And when Absalom’s servants came to the woman to the house, they said, Where is Ahimaaz and Jonathan? And the woman said unto them, They be gone over the brook of water. And when they had sought and could not find them, they returned to Jerusalem.
verses.web: Absalom’s servants came to the woman to the house; and they said, “Where are Ahimaaz and Jonathan?” The woman said to them, “They have gone over the brook of water.” When they had sought and could not find them, they returned to Jerusalem.
verses.ct: When Absalom's men arrived at the house, they asked the woman, "Where are Ahimaaz and Jonathan?" She told them, "They crossed over the brook." The men searched but couldn't find them, so they went back to Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, after they were departed, that they came up out of the well, and went and told king David, and said unto David, Arise, and pass quickly over the water: for thus hath Ahithophel counselled against you.
verses.web: After they had departed, they came up out of the well, and went and told king David; and they said to David, “Arise and pass quickly over the water; for thus has Ahithophel counseled against you.”
verses.ct: After Absalom's men left, Jonathan and Ahimaaz climbed out of the well and hurried to King David. They told him, "Get up and cross the water right away! Ahithophel has advised Absalom to attack you."

verses.kjv: Then David arose, and all the people that were with him, and they passed over Jordan: by the morning light there lacked not one of them that was not gone over Jordan.
verses.web: Then David arose, and all the people who were with him, and they passed over the Jordan. By the morning light there lacked not one of them who had not gone over the Jordan.
verses.ct: David and everyone with him got up and crossed the Jordan. By the time morning came, every last person had made it across.

verses.kjv: And when Ahithophel saw that his counsel was not followed, he saddled his ass, and arose, and gat him home to his house, to his city, and put his household in order, and hanged himself, and died, and was buried in the sepulchre of his father.
verses.web: When Ahithophel saw that his counsel was not followed, he saddled his donkey, arose, and went home, to his city, and set his house in order, and hanged himself; and he died, and was buried in the tomb of his father.
verses.ct: When Ahithophel realized his advice had been rejected, he saddled his donkey and went home to his own city. He put his affairs in order, then hanged himself. He died and was buried in his father's tomb.

verses.kjv: Then David came to Mahanaim. And Absalom passed over Jordan, he and all the men of Israel with him.
verses.web: Then David came to Mahanaim. Absalom passed over the Jordan, he and all the men of Israel with him.
verses.ct: David arrived at Mahanaim. Meanwhile, Absalom crossed the Jordan with all the men of Israel.

verses.kjv: And Absalom made Amasa captain of the host instead of Joab: which Amasa was a man’s son, whose name was Ithra an Israelite, that went in to Abigail the daughter of Nahash, sister to Zeruiah Joab’s mother.
verses.web: Absalom set Amasa over the army instead of Joab. Now Amasa was the son of a man whose name was Ithra the Israelite, who went in to Abigail the daughter of Nahash, sister to Zeruiah, Joab’s mother.
verses.ct: Absalom appointed Amasa as commander of the army in place of Joab. Amasa was the son of a man named Ithra, an Israelite who had slept with Abigail, the daughter of Nahash and sister of Zeruiah, Joab's mother.

verses.kjv: So Israel and Absalom pitched in the land of Gilead.
verses.web: Israel and Absalom encamped in the land of Gilead.
verses.ct: Israel and Absalom set up camp in the land of Gilead.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when David was come to Mahanaim, that Shobi the son of Nahash of Rabbah of the children of Ammon, and Machir the son of Ammiel of Lodebar, and Barzillai the Gileadite of Rogelim,
verses.web: When David had come to Mahanaim, Shobi the son of Nahash of Rabbah of the children of Ammon, and Machir the son of Ammiel of Lodebar, and Barzillai the Gileadite of Rogelim,
verses.ct: When David arrived at Mahanaim, Shobi son of Nahash from Rabbah of the Ammonites, Machir son of Ammiel from Lodebar, and Barzillai the Gileadite from Rogelim

verses.kjv: Brought beds, and basons, and earthen vessels, and wheat, and barley, and flour, and parched corn, and beans, and lentiles, and parched pulse,
verses.web: brought beds, basins, earthen vessels, wheat, barley, meal, parched grain, beans, lentils, roasted grain,
verses.ct: brought beds, basins, clay pots, wheat, barley, flour, roasted grain, beans, lentils, dried seeds,

verses.kjv: And honey, and butter, and sheep, and cheese of kine, for David, and for the people that were with him, to eat: for they said, The people is hungry, and weary, and thirsty, in the wilderness.
verses.web: honey, butter, sheep, and cheese of the herd, for David, and for the people who were with him, to eat; for they said, “The people are hungry, weary, and thirsty in the wilderness.”
verses.ct: honey, butter, sheep, and cheese for David and all the people with him to eat. They said, "These people must be hungry, exhausted, and thirsty from traveling through the wilderness."
